videos.title: Down the ‚ÄúYour Computer Isn't Yours‚Äù rabbit hole and how to patch macOS
videos.description:
This is the 44th episode of the privacy guides series.

In this episode, we go down the ‚ÄúYour Computer Isn't Yours‚Äù rabbit hole and explore how to patch macOS.

Patch üëâ echo "127.0.0.1 ocsp.apple.com isrg.trustid.ocsp.identrust.com" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

Undo patch üëâ sudo sed -i "" "/ocsp\.apple\.com/d" /etc/hosts

videos.title: Why privacy matters
videos.description:
As privacy advocates, we get asked why privacy matters on a regular basis by family, friends and pretty much everyone else.

This is an attempt at answering that challenging question recorded at CreativeMornings/Montreal on the theme of silence (sorry for the poor audio and video quality).

This is also the first public mention of the privacy guides project which, at the time, was only an idea.

I am very happy the project is now underway!

videos.description:

Spoiler: AdBlock has been acquired by an undisclosed buyer, uses Google Analytics to ‚Äúaggregate information about traffic patterns and how [their] website and extension are used‚Äù and ‚Äúsometimes share[s] anonymized and aggregated information that cannot be associated with an individual with third parties or the public‚Äù.

videos.title: Why Macs equipped with the new T2 chip are shitty for hackers
videos.description:
This is my hacker review of the 2019 MacBook Air equipped with the new T2 chip and why I‚Äôm keeping my old mid-2015 MacBook Pro.

Returning or selling a T2-equiped Mac? Backup your data and run `xartutil --erase-all` to clear your T2 chip‚Äôs secure enclave which will brick FileVault, protecting your data from unsuspected eyes.
